lines.content: Miku is a chatbot who can help you keep track of all your upcoming tasks!
### `todo` - adds a new todo task to your list
Add a new task todo to your list. This task does not have any time constraints.
Got it! I've added this task:
Now you have 1 tasks in the list!
### `event` - adds a new event task to your list
Add a new task event to your list. The event has two time parameters of "/from" and "/to",
which are when the event starts and ends.
Got it! I've added this task:
Now you have 2 tasks in the list!
### `deadline` - adds a new deadline task to your list
Add a new task deadline to your list. The deadline has the time parameter of "/by", which is when the deadline is due by.
Got it! I've added this task:
Now you have 3 tasks in the list!
Marks a task as complete in your list. The index is the index of the task you want to mark.
It must be positive and exists in the list.
Good job~! I've marked it as done
### `unmark` - unmarks a task from its done status
Unmarks a task from being complete in your list. The index is the index of the task you want to unmark.
It must be positive and exists in the list.
Aww... I've marked it as undone.
### `list` - lists all the tasks you currently have
The list function will display all your current upcoming tasks as well as if you have completed them or not.
Deletes a task from your list. The index is the index of the task you want to delete.
It must be positive and exists in the list.
Now you have 2 items in your list!
Finds all tasks in your list that fit a provided keyword.
Here are the matching tasks in your list:
* Rewrites the description of the deadline into a format suitable to save onto the text file
* @return The string of the deadline in the correct format
* Returns a String of the deadline consisting of a representation of
* its task type, its marked status and description, and its due date
* @return The string of the deadline in the correct format
* Prints out newly added deadline for the user
System.out.println("Got it! I've added this task:\n" + this.toString());
System.out.println("Now you have " + (numberOfListItems + 1) + " tasks in the list!");
public Event(String description, String from, String to) {
* Rewrites the description of the event into a format suitable to save onto the text file
* @return The string of the event in the correct format
* Returns a String of the event consisting of a representation of
* its task type, its marked status and description, when it starts, and when it ends.
* @return The string of the event in the correct format
* Prints out newly added event for the user
System.out.println("Got it! I've added this task:\n" + this.toString());
System.out.println("Now you have " + (numberOfListItems + 1) + " tasks in the list!");
* Takes in user input and determines what to command to run from the input
* Handles the processes of adding a new task (todo/event/deadline) to the list
* Handles the process of overwriting the current data in the text file
* and writing to it with the current list to save the data
* Overwrites the current data in the saved text file with one task.
* If there is no existing directory/text file, it creates one
* @param textToAdd The String of the first task in the list to be saved in the text file
* Appends to the current data in the saved text file with a task
* @param textToAppend The String of the task in the list to be saved in the text file
* Loads the data from the saved file
* @return loadedTask The list of tasks containing all tasks that had been saved in the text file
* @throws FileNotFoundException If the file does not exist
public static ArrayList<Task> loadData() throws FileNotFoundException {
* Rewrites each task from the load data into a format understandable by other classes.
* @param command The String array of a task loaded from the text file
* @param loadedTasks The list of tasks containing tasks that had been saved in the text file
* @param currentLoadListIndex The current index of the loaded list
public static void transferLoadToArray(String[] command, ArrayList<Task> loadedTasks, int currentLoadListIndex) {
* Returns the icon to display whether the task is marked or not
* @return isDone Returns X if the tasks is marked, blank otherwise.
return (isDone ? "X" : " "); // mark done task with X
* Returns the icon to display whether the task is marked or not
* @return isDone Returns X if the tasks is marked, blank otherwise.
* Rewrites the description of the task into a format suitable to save onto the text file
* @return The string of the task in the correct format
* Returns marked status and description of the task
* @return The string of the task's marked status and description
* Creates a new todo in the current list
* @param newItem A string of the entire user input
public static void newTodo(String newItem, ArrayList<Task> storedTask) throws MikuException {
* Creates a new deadline in the current list
* @param newItem A string of the entire user input
* @throws wrongDeadlineArguments If the given input is not in the proper format (does not contain "/by")
public static void newDeadline(String newItem, ArrayList<Task> storedTask)
* Creates a new event in the current list
* @param newItem A string of the entire user input
* @throws wrongEventArguments If the given input is not in the proper format (does not contain "/from" or "/to")
public static void newEvent(String newItem, ArrayList<Task> storedTask)
* Marks a task from the current list.
* @param taskToMark An array of Strings that contains the user input of the task to mark
* @throws MikuException If the String array length > 2 or = 1
* @throws voidNumberOfItems If the current list is empty
* @throws indexOutOfListBounds If the inputted index of the task to delete does not exist in the list
* Unmarks a given task from the current list.
* @param taskToUnmark An array of Strings that contains the user input of the task to unmark
* @throws MikuException If the String array length > 2 or = 1
* @throws voidNumberOfItems If the current list is empty
* @throws indexOutOfListBounds If the inputted index of the task to delete does not exist in the list
* Deletes a task from the current list.
* @param taskToDelete An array of Strings that contains the user input of the task to delete
* @throws MikuException If the String array length > 2 or = 1
* @throws voidNumberOfItems If the current list is empty
* @throws indexOutOfListBounds If the inputted index of the task to delete does not exist in the list
public static void findKeyword(String inputKeyword) throws MikuException, voidNumberOfItems {

* Prints out the greetings for when the user boots up the chatbot.
System.out.println("Hello! I'm Miku!\n" + "What can I do for you?");
* Prints the text for when a new task is added.
* Prints out the parting text for when the user closes the chatbot.
System.out.println("Bye, hope to see you again soon! :D");
* Prints out the text for when a task is marked.
System.out.println("Good job~! I've marked it as done");
* Prints out the text for when a task is unmarked.
System.out.println("Aww... I've marked it as undone.");
* Prints out the text for when a task is deleted.
* Prints out the number of tasks in the list for the user.
System.out.println("Now you have " + numberOfListItems + " items in your list!");
* Prints out the entire current list.
System.out.println("Here are the matching tasks in your list:");
System.out.println("Deadline is incomplete, did you forget to type something?");
System.out.println("You didn't add when it's due by D:");
System.out.println("Event is incomplete, did you forget to type something?");
System.out.println("You incorrectly inputted the arguments D:");
System.out.println("You forgot to say what to mark.");
System.out.println("You forgot to say what to unmark.");
System.out.println("Enter the number index of the item.");
System.out.println("There are no items in your list :(");
System.out.println("Error! Try to input an index that exists in your current list instead.");
System.out.println("there's something wrong with the loaded data's arguments");
System.out.println("There are no tasks that match your keyword :(");
